channel.title: Replacenemt for Neutral Killers
channel.description:
Neutral Killers are a bit necessary right now because whitout them, games might potentially last too long. They make sure the game progress at a decent speed.
That being said, i feel like they are simply not fun. Dying to a serial killer is always frustrating. It also makes the game rely massively on RNG. As an example, if the Reaper kills the cult leader or the prince in night 1,it makes a super massive difference.
I would instead propose to introduce "King's hunger for blood".
People would always be forced to execute one person every day. If nobody has been executed, then whoever the king is currently voting will be executed.
If the king has not voted anybody, then HE dies.
This mecanic, i believe, would have the following effects:
1: I think it would actually help new players. New players tend to play very passively, only ever executing someone if they have proof of it. This is a poor strategy especially against cult.
2: It would help Kings. Right now, as king, if you ever get someone executed and you are wrong about it, people usually all think you are evil. Whenever a BD is executed, its always the king's fault. This mecanic would allow kings to execute people they think might be evil, but town could forgive the king if they're wrong.
3: Would help the game stay fast paced, but instead of the deaths being decided by the RNG of a serial killer, it would actually be the players that decide who is executed.
Let me know what you think :)

item.title: Replacenemt for Neutral Killers
item.dc:creator: Floofyboy
item.description:
Icibalus:

The whole point of NKs is to be much harder to win as classes since they have next to no allies.
Dying is not fun in general, so logiclaly all death should be removed, if that’s your logic.

I agree dying is never fun, but some deaths are worst than others. Dying to RNG feels worst than dying protecting the king as knight for example.

Icibalus:

As for making BD’s lynch compulsive, scumreading is perfectly possibile in ToL, but it’s far less accurate than in a real life or forum setting, Real Life because people have twitches and body language to read, and on a forum because there are several days worth of posts that could have slips in them.

That is a valid point. The days in tol are extremely short compared to the other site i played on (often lasted 10 minutes+). So scum hunting is obviously harder. But short days isn’t a bad thing.

Icibalus:

Let’s be honest, our main scumtell inside ToL is still ‘THEY WERE QUIET, LYNCH LYNCH LYNCH’
So that won’t work, since tells aren’t accurate enough.

That’s personally not the strategy i use. The main thing i look at is how the log is constructed, how they vote (how fast they voted for unseens), if they executed or not, things like that. I don’t think quiet means much of anything. Except for kings.

Icibalus:

I’m glad that you are clearly an FM player, but we aren’t removing what is in fact an essential tool for balance, giving the informed minority and the informed majority both something they want dead, masking push motivations a little, and also to accelerate the KPN to speed up the game. I know your compulsive lynch idea would work in an FM game, even if people would get a bit miffed they literally have no choice, but NKs really are essential for the game’s balance.

Actually i’m not an FM player. I come from epic mafia which is also real time, but the days are very long (often 10 minutes+, sometimes more).

item.title: Replacenemt for Neutral Killers
item.dc:creator: Floofyboy
item.description:
Only executing with evidence is actually a bad habit imo. Of course, completetly random lynch is a bad idea, but lets say you are king, you should already know like 2-3 guys who are clear. Then bad guys usually give some clues, like the way they vote, the way they talk, what their log looks like, etc.

As an example, i often had games in werewolf games (in other sites) with no investigate roles at all, and good players are very good at identifying the bad guys with 0 evidence.
